info.title: Ometria data API
info.description:
Welcome to the Ometria API reference.


The Ometria API is organized around the [REST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer) methodology, and it uses resource-oriented URLs, and common HTTP response codes to indicate API errors. All requests are authenticated using an API key which can be obtained from your account settings.

### HTTPS

All requests to the Ometria API MUST be carried out via HTTPS. API servers do not listen on unsecured HTTP ports to avoid the possibility of insecure information exchange.

### Message encoding

The V2 Ometria API uses JSON encoding for all data exchanges and assumes UTF-8 character encoding throughout.

### Rate limits

The Ometria API has a default rate limit of 4 requests per second per Ometria account. If you expect to exceed this limit, please contact us.

In the case of your application being rate limited, the HTTP code 429 (too many requests) will be returned. In this case your application should reduce the number of requests it is trying to send.

Note that the asynchronous push API also has a maximum of 50,000 asynchronous import records. If you attempt to push more than this number of records in a short timeframe, you will also receive the HTTP 429 status code.

post.description: Accepts a list of up to 100 records of any of the accepted types: contact, custom event, product, profile or order

403.description: API key is not authorised to access this resource

get.description: Return a list of products with optional filters

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of items to return. Max 250.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of first the record to return.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Should we return only active or inactive products? `True` to return only active. 'False' to return only inactive. If this parameter is not defined, both active and inactive products are returned.

403.description: API key is not authorised to access this resource

get.description: Return a single Product item

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: The ID of the product to return.

403.description: API key is not authorised to access this resource

404.description: Product with specified ID was not found

parameters.name: limit

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of first record to return.

parameters.name: order_id

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to return. Maximum 250.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first record.

403.description: API key is not authorised to access this resource

404.description: Order with specified ID was not found

parameters.name: event_type

parameters.description: The event ID

get.description: Return profiles as a JSON array

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to fetch. Maximum 250.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index of first record to fetch

parameters.name: updateSince
parameters.description:
Only return contacts that have been updated since this date.
This does not return contacts who have entered or exited a dynamic segment in that time.

get.summary: Receive unsubscribed contacts within a time range.
get.description: Returns unsubscribe events where the event was triggered from preferences centre, app, list unsubscribe (generated when the contact clicks the "unsubscribe" button in their email client), or link unsubscribe (generated when the contact clicks a link that is formatted for Ometria to recognise it).

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The earliest date from which to fetch unsubscribe data. Following time format YYYY-MM-DDTH:I:S in UTC.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The latest date from which to fetch unsubscribe data. Following time format YYYY-MM-DDTH:I:S in UTC.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of unsubscribe event to return.

403.description: API key is not authorised to access this resource.

parameters.name: id

apikey.name: X-Ometria-Auth
apikey.description: Ometria API key which can be obtained from your Ometria account administrator

ContactCollection.description: Describes a collection of Contact listing records.

count.description: The number of records belonging to the collection.

Contact.title: Contact
Contact.description: Describes an individual Contact listing record.

@type.description: The value must be "contact". This shows that this record represents a contact object.

@collection.description: The collection you want the contact to belong to.

id.description: The ID of this listing within the collection, max length: 255

email.description:
The contact's email address, max length: 255, lower case.
If left empty this field will be set to 'null'.

phone_number.description: The contact's mobile phone number, in E.164/International format (e.g. starting "+447...")

customer_id.description:
Your universal customer ID for this contact, if applicable. max length: 255.
Only use this value if the customer ID is persistent across all your systems (that send data to Ometria).

@add_to_lists.description: The ID of the segment you want to send this contact to, max length: 16.

@remove_from_lists.description: The ID of the segment you want to remove this contact from, max length: 16.

@force_optin.description: If 'True', this field overrides marketing opt-in priority.

@merge.description: If 'True', this call will not override blank fields (i.e. fields that exist but aren't passed)

prefix.description: The contact's title, e.g. Mr, Ms, etc. max length: 16.

firstname.description: The contact's first name, max length: 64.

middlename.description: The contact's middle name, max length: 64.

lastname.description: The contact's last name, max length: 64.

gender.description:
The contact's gender.
We currently support the values "m" (man), "f" (woman) and "o" (other).
Use the value "o" when the contact's gender is known but it is not "m" or "f". If the contact's gender is unknown then the field "gender" should not be included.
If left empty this field will be set to 'null'.

date_of_birth.description:
The contact's date of birth.
Following ISO 8601 date format YYYY-MM-DD.

country_id.description:
The contact's country, must be 2 characters, upper case, e.g. 'GB'.
Follow ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.
If you exceed the character limit this field will pass validation but appear truncated in Ometria.
If left empty this field will be set to 'null'.

store_ids.description:
An array of strings for which stores the customer belongs to.
max length: 31, lower case.
If left empty this field will be set to 'null'.

timezone.description: As defined in the tz database, max length: 64.

timestamp_acquired.description:
The date and time the contact was 'acquired'. Only provide this if known.
Follow ISO 8601 DateTime format with timezone offset YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z

timestamp_subscribed.description:
The date and time the contact was 'acquired'. Only provide this if known.
Follow ISO 8601 DateTime format with timezone offset YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z

timestamp_unsubscribed.description:
The date and time the contact was 'unsubscribed'. Only provide if known.
Follow ISO 8601 DateTime format with timezone offset YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z

channels.description: Contact preferences across different communication channels, e.g. SMS

allow_marketing.description: Whether the contact is opted in/out for SMS marketing. If left out, this implies unspecified.

allow_transactional.description: Whether the contact is opted in/out to transactional SMS. If left out, it implies 'unspecified'.

dt_updated_marketing.description:
The date and time the contact updated their marketing SMS preference.
Onlyprovide if known.
Follow ISO 8601 DateTime format with timezone offset YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z

dt_updated_transactional.description:
The date and time the contact updated their transactional SMS preference. Only
provide if known.
Follow ISO 8601 DateTime format with timezone offset YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z

CustomEvent.title: Custom Event
CustomEvent.description: Describes a custom event. One of "profile_id", "identity_email", "identity_account_id" is required.

@type.description: The value must be "custom_event". This shows that this record represents a custom_event object.

id.description:
The custom event ID, max length: 32.
If you exceed the character limit the field will pass validation but appear truncated in Ometria.

event_type.description: The custom_event type, maximum charaxters 64. If you exceed the character limit the field will pass validation but appear truncated in Ometria.

timestamp.description: The date and time of the event, following ISO 8601 DateTime format with timezone offset YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z.

properties.description: Properties to be used in the custom event. These are defined by you.

profile_id.description: The profile ID of the contact on which to trigger this custom event.

identity_email.description:
The email of the contact record on which to trigger this custom event, max length: 255, lower case.
If left empty this field will be set to 'null'.

identity_account_id.description: The contact ID of the contact record on which to trigger this custom event.

CustomEventProperties.description: These are the custom fields you need to add for your custom event. There are 5 types available for custom event fields: string, boolean, number, products list and date.

string_custom_field.description:
Any characters permitted, including accents and other character symbols.
String fields have a 64 character limit.

products_list_custom_field.description: Returns a list of your products

List.description: Describes a segment in Ometria (a dynamic or static list of Contacts).

@type.description: The value must be "list". This shows that this record represents a list object.

timestamp_created.description: Date and time of when the list was created. Following ISO 8601 dateTime format with timezone offset _YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z_.

timestamp_last_refreshed.description: Date and time of when the list was last refreshed. Following ISO 8601 dateTime format with timezone offset _YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z_.

timestamp_stats_updated.description: Date and time of when the list's stats (size, total_revenue and total_orders) were last updated. Following ISO 8601 dateTime format with timezone offset _YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z_.

size.description: The number of contacts which belong to this list.

total_revenue.description: The total revenue of contacts who belong to this list.

total_orders.description: The total number of orders which have been placed by contacts who belong to this list.

ListChanges.description: Describes a change to a segment (list)

profile_id.description: The profile ID of the contact whom has entered or exited a list

email.description: The email address of the contact

timestamp.description: Date and time of when the change occurred. Following ISO 8601 dateTime format with timezone offset _YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z_.

event.description: The type of list change event.

DataDeletionRequest.description: Describes a GDPR related data anonymisation request

timestamp_created.description: Date and time of request being filed. Following ISO 8601 dateTime format with timezone offset _YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z_.

timestamp_completed.description: Date and time of request being processed. Following ISO 8601 dateTime format with timezone offset _YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z_.

action.description: The action to take on this individual's data. Currently he only supported value is "anonymise"

summary.description: A textual summary of the records found and modified after processing.

source.description: A summary of where the request originated, e.g. from with the application or via API.

identities.description: A list of hashed email addresses that represent the identities of individuals processed in this request.

DataDeletionSubmission.description: GDPR related data anonymisation request submission

email_address.description: Email address of individual who requested anonymisation

action.description: The action to take on this individual's data. The only supported value currently is "anonymise"

@type.description: The value must be "order". This shows that this record represents an order object.

id.description:
The order ID, max length: 36.
If you exceed the character limit this field will pass validation but will appear truncated in Ometria.

timestamp.description:
The date and time the order was placed on the site or in store.
Follow ISO 8601 DateTime format with timezone offset YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z.

grand_total.description: The grand total of the order.

subtotal.description: The subtotal of this order after refunds have been taken.

discount.description: This value should be negative or 0. Not positive.

shipping.description: The shipping cost of this order.

tax.description: The tax of this order after refunds have been taken.

currency.description:
The currency used for this order, must be 3 characters, upper case, e.g. GBP, USD.
Follow ISO 4217.
If left empty this field is set to 'null'.

web_id.description:
The web ID passed through the JavaScript tracker - this is only required if the value is different to the id.
max length: 32. If you exceed the character limit the field will pass validation but appear truncated in Ometria.

status.description: Code representing the status of this order 'complete', 'pending', 'shipped' etc.

is_valid.description: Is this order considered valid and should be counted against revenue? Set to false to 'delete'.

customer.description: The details of the customer who placed the order.

lineitems.description: Array of [OrderLineItem](#definition-OrderLineItem) objects representing the items in this order.

ip_address.description:
The IP address of the visitor who placed order (if known).
max length: 64.

channel.description: Channel of this order. E.g., 'online', 'instore', 'amazon' etc.

store.description: Code representing the store the order was placed in.

payment_method.description:
Code representing payment method, max length: 32.
If you exceed the character limit this field will pass validation but appear truncated in Ometria.

shipping_address.description: The address the customer used for shipping.

billing_address.description: The address the customer used for billing.

coupon_code.description: Coupon code applied to this order.

properties.description: Custom key / value pairs accessible in emails using this order object.

city.description:
The city or town for this address, max length: 32, lower case.
Follow ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.
If you exceed the character limit this field will pass validation but appear truncated in Ometria.
If left empty this field is set to 'null'.

state.description:
The state or county of the address, max length: 32, lower case.
If you exceed the character limit this field will pass validation but appear truncated in Ometria.
If left empty this field is set to 'null'.

postcode.description:
The postcode or zipcode of the address, max length: 32, lower case.
If you exceed the character limit this field will pass validation but appear truncated in Ometria.
If left empty this field is set to 'null'.

country_code.description:
The country for this address, must be 2 characters, upper case, e.g. 'GB'.
Follow ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.
If left empty this field is set to 'null'.

OrderCustomer.description: The details of the customer who placed the order.

id.description: The customer's ID, max length: 255. This can be any unique identifier you use for your customers which you'd like to use for reporting in Ometria. It must not contain any personally identifiable information (name, email address etc.)

email.description:
The customer's email address, max length: 255, lower case.
If left empty this field is set to 'null'.

firstname.description: The customer's first name, max length: 64.

lastname.description: The customer's last name, max length: 64.

OrderLineItem.description: Describes an individual product line item added to an Order.

variant_id.description: The ID of the product variant (if applicable), max length: 255

quantity.description: The number of products in the line item (not inclusive of any refunded items).

sku.description:
The SKU of the product in this line item, max length: 255.
If this field is left empty it will be set to 'null'.

unit_price.description: The unit price of the product in this line item.

quantity_refunded.description: The number of products refunded in the line item.

refunded.description: The total price of refunded products in this line item.

subtotal.description: The subtotal of this line item after refunds have been taken.

tax.description: The tax value of this line item after refunds have been taken.

total.description: The total price of this line item after refunds amounts have been taken.

discount.description:
The value of any discount applied to the order.
This value should be either a negative number, e.g. -`2.99` or `0`.

is_on_sale.description: Set to 'True' if the product was on sale when the order was placed.

properties.description: Custom key / value pairs accessible in emails using the related Order object.

OrderLineItemVariantOption.description: Describes the configurable options attached to a Lineitem.

type.description: The type of the variant option.

id.description: The id of the variant option.

label.description: The label of the variant option.

@type.description: The value must be "order". This shows that this record represents an order object.

timestamp.description: Time the order was placed on the site or in store. Following ISO 8601 dateTime format with timezone offset _YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z_.

web_id.description: The web ID passed with through the JS tracker, this is only required if the value is different to the id.

status.description: Code representing the status of this order, e.g. 'complete', 'pending', 'shipped' etc, max length: 32.

is_valid.description: Whether or not the order is valid, i.e. payment was correctly processed. Valid orders are counted in revenue reporting. Use `True` for valid orders, `False` for invalid orders.

lineitems.description: Array of OrderLineItem objects representing the items in this order.

items.description: Describes an individual product line item added to an Order.

product_id.description: The ID of the product in this line item, max length: 255.

quantity.description:
The number of products in the line item (excluding any refunded items).
This field is required if you are using the lineitem array.

unit_price.description: The unit price of the product in this line item.

quantity_refunded.description: The number of products refunded in the line item.

totals.description: The totals of the lineitem. This field can be used to express the order value in an account base currency and a local currency.

is_on_sale.description: Indicating whether the product was on sale when the order was placed.

properties.description: Custom key / value pairs accessible in emails using the related Order object.

ip_address.description: IP address of visitor who placed order if known.

channel.description:
The channel this order came through, e.g., 'online', 'in store', 'mobile app' etc.
This can be a useful reporting filter in Ometria, so it is helpful to differentiate your channels as much as possible.
Maximum chararacters 16. If you exceed the character limit this field will pass validation, but appear truncated in Ometria.

store.description:
Code representing the store the order was placed in, max length: 32, lower case.
If left empty this field is set to 'null'.

shipping_method.description:
Code representing shipping method, max length: 100.
If you exceed the character limit this field will pass validation but appear truncated in Ometria.

coupon_code.description:
The coupon code applied to this order, max length: 100, lower case.
If left empty this field is set to 'null'.

properties.description: Custom key / value pairs accessible in emails using this order object.

OrderExtendedTotals.description: The totals of the order in a base currency and a local currency.

OrderExtendedLocalTotal.description: The totals of this order represented in the local currency

currency.description: The currency of the local totals.  Following ISO 4217

shipping.description: The value of the shipping in the local currency

tax.description: The value of the tax in the local currency

discount.description: The value of the discount in the local currency as a negative number

subtotal.description: The value of the subtotal in the local currency

grand_total.description: The grand total of the order.

OrderExtendedBaseTotal.description: The totals of this order represented in the base currency

currency.description: The base currency totals - as set for your account. Following ISO 4217

shipping.description: The value of the shipping in the base currency

tax.description: The value of the tax in the base currency

discount.description: The value of the discount in the base currency as a negative number

subtotal.description: The value of the subtotal in the base currency

grand_total.description: The value of the grand total in the base currency

OrderExtendedLineItemTotals.description: The totals of the lineitem. This can be used to express the order value in a base currency and a local currency.

OrderExtendedLineItemLocalTotal.description: The totals of this lineitem represented in the local currency

currency.description: The currency of the local lineitem totals. Following ISO 4217

unit_price.description: The value of the unit price in the local currency

discount.description:
The value of any discount applied to the line item.
This value should be either a negative number, e.g. -`2.99` or `0`.

refunded.description: The total price of refunded products in this line item.

subtotal.description: The subtotal of this lineitem in the local currency (after refunded amounts have been taken into consideration).

tax.description: The tax of this lineitem in the local currency (after refunded amounts have been taken into consideration).

total.description: The total price of this lineitem in the local currency (after refunded amounts have been taken into consideration).

OrderExtendedLineItemBaseTotal.description: The totals of this lineitem represented in the base currency

currency.description: The currency of the base lineitem totals - as set for your account. Following ISO 4217

unit_price.description: The value of the unit price in the base currency

discount.description: The value of the discount on the lineitem in the base currency as a negative number

refunded.description: The total price of refunded products in this line item.

subtotal.description: The subtotal of this lineitem in the base currency (after refunded amounts have been taken into consideration).

tax.description: The tax of this lineitem in the base currency (after refunded amounts have been taken into consideration).

total.description: The total price of this line item in the base currency (after refunded amounts have been taken into consideration).

@type.description: The value must be "product". This shows that this record represents a product object.

id.description: The ID of the product. Max length: 255.

title.description:
The title of this product as displayed to customers, max length: 140.
If you exceed the character limit, this field will pass validation but appear truncated in the Ometria interface.

is_variant.description: Whether or not this product record represents a variant product.

price.description: The default display price (account default currency / store).

sku.description:
The SKU of the product, max length: 255.
If left empty this field is set to `null`.

special_price_dt_from.description: Optional. The datetime that the special price begins. Format YYYY-MM-DD HH:II:SS.

special_price_dt_to.description: Optional. The datetime that the special price ends. Format YYYY-MM-DD HH:II:SS.

special_price.description: Optional. A special (discounted) price used in conjunction with special_price_dt_from and special_price_dt_to.

is_active.description: Is this product considered active on the website?. E.g. is it visible and (in principle) buyable? Please use "is_in_stock" to indicate whether a product is in stock or not.

url.description: The URL to the product's page on your site, max length: 1024.

image_url.description: The URL to the product's image on your site, max length: 1024.

listings.description: Array of ProductListing objects used to work out which stores this product is available in, and any store specific details.

properties.description: Custom key / value pairs accessible in emails using this product object

ProductAttribute.description: Describes an attribute attached to a Product.

type.description:
The type of the attribute, max length: 128.
This field is required if you are using the attributes array.

id.description: The ID of the attribute, max length: 128.

label.description: The label of the attribute, max length: 128

ProductListing.description: Describes an individual store listing for a product.

title.description:
The title of the product, max length: 140.
If you exceed the character limit the field will pass validation but appear truncated in Ometria.

store.description:
Required. Identifier representing the store the product belongs to. This will match the code passed in an order.
Max length: 32, must be lower case. Example: `_store_1234`.

currency.description:
The currency for this product listing.
Must follow ISO 4217 format, max length: 3, upper case.
This field is required if you are using the listings array.
If left empty this field is set to 'null'.

is_active.description:
Is this product listing considered active on the website? I.e. Is it visible and available to purchase?
Use "is_in_stock" to indicate whether a product is in stock or not.

special_price.description: A special (discounted) price used in connection with special_price_dt_from and special_price_dt_to on the parent product object.

url.description: The URL to this product listing on your site, max length: 1024.

image_url.description: The URL to the product listing's image on your site, max length: 1024.

@type.description: The value must be "profile". This shows that this record is a profile object.

id.description: The ID of this profile record.

email.description: The email address of this contact profile.

name.description: The name of this contact profile.

lifecycle_status.description: The lifecycle status of this contact profile.

seen.description: Whether the contact profile has been seen on your website. Using the identify method in the JS tracker.

customer_id.description: The customer ID of this contact profile.

firstname.description: The first name of this contact profile.

middlename.description: The middle name of this contact profile.

lastname.description: The last name of this contact profile.

prefix.description: The prefix of this contact profile.

suffix.description: The suffix of this contact profile.

country.description: The country ID of this contact profile. Following ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

gender.description: The gender for this contact profile.

tags.description: Custom tags assigned to this profile in the Ometria UI.

properties.description: Custom key / value pairs of this contact profile.

date_of_birth.description: The date of birth for this contact. Following ISO 8601 date format _YYYY-MM-DD_.

marketing_optin.description: TRUE if this contact has explicitly opted in. FALSE if they have explicitly opted out. NULL otherwise.

ProfileStats.description: Contains numeric stats of a profile.

orders.description: Number of valid orders this profile has placed.

orders_attempted.description: Number of orders attempted by this contact profile (this includes valid as well as invalid orders).

aov.description: Average order value of this contact profile.

revenue.description: Total revenue for this contact profile.

visits.description: Total number of visits for this contact profile.

ProfileDates.description: Contains date / time information of a profile

first_seen.description: The date time when this contact was first seen.

last_seen.description: The date time when this contact was last seen.

first_purchase.description: The date time when this contact first placed an order.

last_purchase.description: The date time when this contact last placed an order.

acquired.description: The date time when this contact was acquired.

marketing_optin.description: The date time when this contact opted in to receive marketing emails.

marketing_optout.description: The date time when this contact opted out to no longer receive marketing emails.

ProfileIdentities.description: Contains identity information used to construct the profile

ProfileLists.description: Contains the saved segments (lists) that a profile belongs to.

subject.description: The subject line to be used in the email.

transactional.description: Whether this email should be considered transactional or not.

stream.description: A string that can be made up for tracking purposes.

profile_id.description: Enter a profile ID to make profile information available as dynamic content for using in your email templates.

template_id.description: The ID of the HTML email template to be used.

data.description: Data passed in this object will be made available as dynamic content which you can merge into the template before sending.

sandbox.description: To be used during testing. When set to "True", the email will be processed but not sent.

html.description: The HTML version of the email.

text.description: The Text version of the email.

PushResponse.description: The outcome of a push request.

rejected.description: Number of records rejected, due to invalid format or data

skipped.description: Number of records skipped, due to duplication

PushRequest.description: An array of either contact/order/product records.

record_type.description: The type of the pushed record.

record_id.description: The id of the pushed record.

record.description: Copy of the pushed record which raised an error.

timestamp.description: Datetime that the record was received. Format _YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+Z_.

PushErrorMessage.description: Describes what value is not correct and why

error_path.description: Location of the error within the pushed record.

example.error_message: Value must be at least 1 characters.

profile_id.description: The profile id of the contact whom has unsubscribed.

email_address.description: The email address of the contact whom has unsubscribed.

type.description: The type of unsubscribe event. This indicates where the contact unsubscribed (e.g., "preferences_centre").

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the unsubscribe event.

reason_text.description: The reason provided for unsubscribing in the free-text field.
